comments.purpose: Repair worker node; connects to origin, claims repair jobs, and executes fragment reconstruction
comments.onboarding: Default template, typically set node name to a unique per repair node and start satellite.py. Open 8891/7888 if inbound from origin is needed

network.origin_host: IP/DNS of origin control plane (required to fetch jobs and register)
network.origin_port: Origin control plane port (8888 by default)
network.listen_host: IP to bind for inbound control (0.0.0.0 = all interfaces)
network.listen_port: Local control plane port for this repair node (8891 default)
network.repair_rpc_port: Port used for repair RPCs (7888 default); must be reachable by origin

paths.cert: TLS cert issued/approved by origin (client auth)
paths.key: Private key for this repair node cert
paths.origin_pubkey: Origin public key for verifying control messages

sync.node_sync_interval: Seconds between heartbeat syncs to origin (advertises reachability)
sync.registry_sync_interval: Seconds between registry refreshes from origin (satellite/storage list)
sync.origin_pubkey_url: Where to fetch origin public key if missing
sync.list_json_url: Where to fetch trusted node registry if missing

comments.notes: No storage or placement policy here; this node only rebuilds fragments on demand. Keep clock synced (NTP) for TLS validity.
